questions.question_text:
You need to develop a chat application, which allows the display of emoticons and images together with text messages.
How should you configure a WebSocket endpoints to receive both text and binary messages?

discussion.content: D is correct as per some other sites

choices.C: You can achieve this only by creating separate WebSocket endpoints for each message type.
choices.D: Create two @onMessage methods, each with appropriate decoder attribute in the same endpoint.
choices.B: Define the @onMessage methods in your endpoint with Object as parameter and check the actual type in your code.
choices.A: Create two @onMessage methods in the same endpoint with appropriate parameter types.

questions.question_text:
Given the code fragment from a Facelet page:
//IMG//

On Line 1, you ae asked to insert a search box that displays the text "Search Here" via a placeholder.
Assume searchMB is a valid Managed Bean.
Which two options enable you to create a search box with a placeholder attribute on Line 1? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
It seems that C is the correct answer.
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/javax/xml/bind/helpers/AbstractMarshallerImpl.html#setEventHandler-javax.xml.bind.ValidationEventHandler-

There is no correct answer! Correct is setValidating(true)
or setSchema(javax.xml.validation.Schema) because method setValidating(true) is deprecated.
https://docs.oracle.com/javaee/7/api/javax/xml/bind/Unmarshaller.html#:~:text=By%20default%2C%20the%20Unmarshaller%20does,one%20of%20the%20unmarshal%20methods.

questions.question_text: How do you specify a default error page in your web.xml file?

choices.D: Replace line 3 with: public @Inject Account getAcc()
choices.B: Replace line 3 with: @Inject public Account getAcc()
choices.C: Replace line 1 with: @Inject private Account acc;
choices.A: Replace line 2 with: @Inject public void setAcc(Account acc)
choices.E: Replace line 1 with: private @Inject Account acc;
choices.F: Replace line 2 with: public void setAcc(@Inject Account acc)

discussion.content: *not F, E is correct too. A,C and E works
Answer A, C... not E. Tested on NetBeans
Answers are C, E, tested on NetBeans
